author: mostafa
title: USA East Coast Cardano CommunityHub
description: There are 500+ Colleges, and 9,000+ IT companies in the NorthEastern US, and no Community Hub. How can we reach this market in the best way?

f6_assessments.q0: Theoretically, the idea is good and fits the objectives of the challenge, however, the proposal is explained in a very superficial way. Overall, the proponent intends to create a local community center that would serve Philadelphia and surrounding communities to attend conferences on Cardano. From what I understand, the place would be geared towards debate, learning and exchanging experiences in relation to our blockchain. This seems quite relevant given that, according to the proponent “there is an untapped market in the Philadelphia tri-state area of ​​universities with IT departments, technology companies, financial companies and many crypto enthusiasts”. In other words, the field is fertile, there are several people who can potentially become active members of the Cardano community, whether through participation in Catalyst as CA, vCAs; or even by submitting proposals; perhaps these people would buy and delegate Ada, increasing investment in our currency; In short, there are several ways in which this group could be involved in the activities and opportunities of our ecosystem. However, as I said at the beginning of the analysis, the proposal as a whole is very abstract, we know that conferences would take place, but what issues would be addressed exactly? Who would present these lectures? How would the local public be motivated to participate? How often would they happen? It is true that the United States is one of the countries in which blockchain technology already has more strength and is well known, but that does not exclude the need for the proponent to make it very clear how he will captivate the common citizen, who does not know what he is doing. is about blockchain, to participate in these events. Even those who already have some involvement with Cardano: how will they find out about such conferences? For me, the most important thing was to clarify these two things: how people would be notified of these meetings and also what content would be covered exactly at each conference. The proposal aligns with the challenge as we seek here to develop and expand knowledge about Cardano for a specific audience, and I believe that the proponent would be focusing a lot on the local community with this project, but it would also be interesting for him to explain how the specificities of the group in issue would be taken into account when promoting the events. Summing up my opinion, I think the idea makes sense with the challenge in theory, but in practice, it lacks a lot of detail.
f6_assessments.q1: The feasibility of the project is low. The script is very superficial, we know only superficially what would be done according to the weeks. For example, it would take 5 weeks to do a “Comprehensive Extension and Market Research”. As well? What would a comprehensive extension be? How would market research be done? One month of the project would be dedicated to “Advertising Campaign Design, Event Planning, Infrastructure Setup”. These things are quite different and require a lot of work and effort individually, and it would be necessary for the bidder to explain each of them in detail. For example, advertising campaign design, it would be important to know what strategies would be taken, as design is a very broad area that can involve the realization of illustrations, marketing campaigns on social media, dissemination through posters in cities... From How would this be done, within the various existing possibilities? Regarding event planning, this part encompasses many, many actions. The physical space would have to be chosen, who would present the conferences (who would be the speakers), how the target audience would be approached, what specific content would be the focus of each meeting and so on. All activities cited by the proponent should be further explained. I also think that the way he explains the passage of time is kind of confusing, some activities would happen in parallel, so it would be better if he split the time into weeks, and accurately scored what would be done each week and in what order. Leaving now for the analysis of the budget, the proponent asks for the amount of 27,500 dollars to carry out this project. The explanation of the use of this money is also superficial, the proponent divides the total amount in percentages, allocating how much each part of the project would need. For example in “Infrastructure, Equipment, Labor: 50%” how much would go to infrastructure, how much to equipment and how much to labor? How many people would work on the project and for how many days a week? In this way, we would have an idea of ​​the price of their working hours, if an exact value was assigned to how much money would go towards wages. I think that part of the proposal is totally inappropriate. And finally, about team, no team is presented. We don't know who the people involved were, their professional backgrounds, what previous experiences they had, how they would relate to the Cardano ecosystem... Anyway, nothing is said about it, so no confidence is passed in a team that we don't know. . We only have information about the proponent, but we would need to have information about everyone involved. In general, all parts of this topic need to be rephrased.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability of the project is also not good. There are no safe ways to monitor either the process or the final results. Starting with the process, all that the proponent tells us are some things that could serve as indicators for the partial success of the project, I believe, namely: “Impressions, Calls, Clicks, Conversions, Subscriptions and Participants”. But these words are presented quite loosely, we don't know how to clearly correlate them with the development of the project. What I suggest is that, after the proposer reformulates the script, dividing the time into weeks and explaining in more detail the activities that would be developed and each of them, he should make a weekly report and send it to the Cardano community. This report should contain a summary of how everyone's work went that week, whether everyone involved in the project fulfilled their obligations in that time period, whether there were any problems, delays or dissonances, whether the week's goals were achieved, and so on. This report could be written and posted on some online platform, such as Notion or Google Docs. As the weeks went by, the proponent could develop this platform by adding the respective files each week. Regarding the final result, the proponent says that success would be perceived with the holding of the first face-to-face event, with the participation and feedback of the target audience. But I think the final scenario should target all encounters, not just the first one, right? All conferences should be monitored, so that we know if everything went the way it was planned. A survey could also be carried out on how these conferences impacted the local community, if the investment in our blockchain has become a reality, how these advances in relation to Cardano can be perceived, etc. All this can also be posted on the online sharing apps that I have suggested, and in this way, the final scenario of success should be traced. Therefore, I think auditability still has a lot to improve, the way it is presented to us is not possible to have a clear view of how this process could be done.

f6_assessments.q0:
The Proposer wants to create Hubs in the Philadelphia Tri-State area, that will introduce people to and provide information regarding the Cardano ecosystem. He is hoping to also have an impact on growing the need for people to make use of the Cardano Blockchain.
This should have a positive impact on the Cardano Eco System and is in line with the challenge brief. The Key Performance indicators are not set out in detail, so I can not measure it to that of the Challenge brief. He does state his outreach would be 500+ universities and 9000+ corporations. I would have liked to see a bit more around what information exactly the Hubs would be providing and how.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer does not give a Linked-In link and I could not find him there, I did however find him on Twitter and he is actively posting and promoting Cardano there with 2181 followers at the time I checked. He also has the meet-up site that is still in its early stages. It is clear he has a passion for Cardano, and I appreciate the fact that he made a vidie to introduce himself and describe his plan in brief. It is always nice to see an actual person talking about his proposal.
This round of the challenge is more focused on creating MVHs (Minimum Viable Hubs). The proposer is requesting USD 27500 which is 0.5% over the preferred total Challenge budget of 5%, so is very close to the preferred percentage.
I feel the budget could be broken down a little more, like Marketing - how much would go towards Social media, Print Media, Radio or what else he has planned. The Infrastrucrure and labour budget is 50% of the requested funds. Maybe break this down also a bit, stating what equipment, resources and their cost, the hrs of labour and the rate per hour charged etc. This will make it easier to see if the requested funds are realistic. Indicate if additional funding would be required in future as the Hub/s grow. Set out your team and their exprience and what they will be bringing to the table, like who will be presenting, educating people at events or seminars.
This is a good first proposal. Keep on working on it.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer does provide a Road Map / Time line, which is good, but I would have liked to see him project a bit further than 3 months, and the amount of members and organizations he hopes to onboard over 3, 6 and 12 months. 
He hopes to achieve a 10% conversion from his attendees to attend regular events.  It would be good to indicate how the progress of the Hub/s will be reported, will it be via twitter, Facebook ect so that the community can follow progress. For instance posting the success achieved by every event, how many attendees and any other goals achieved through an event. The proposer show a passion for Cardano and should keep on pursuing his vision.

f6_assessments.q0: The object of the project approaching to develop the Cardano community is very potential, so it requires the center's team to have deep industry knowledge, and this is also a big challenge to maintain and develop sustainably. Instead of incurring the risks and costs of facilities, I think you should build an east coast USA community on social channels first, when the strong community will come together to create an outside meeting center
f6_assessments.q1: The project implementation plan is reasonable, but the project budget is sketchy and needs more detail for community review. At the same time, as mentioned above, in order to implement the project, it is necessary to have a strong team with deep industry expertise and diverse fields of activity, but the project does not list the members and their communication channels.
f6_assessments.q2: The factors you listed are very easy to quantify, I would like to add a few things such as construction records, lease contracts, photos, videos ... All will be more intuitive. Regarding "What does the success of this project look like?", you may have misspelled something in the "Please provide details of your team members required for the project this”, so you should fix it.

f6_assessments.q0:
I like how the project takes advantage of a location that is already prone to be interested in Cardano. This decreases the risk of making major investments with little return and brings qualified people to Project Catalyst.
However, I am not 100% sure this project would have a big impact on the local community as expected by the challenge.
The mentions the use of volunteers to execute it, however, this is a very risky strategy. Volunteers don't usually have the same commitment as paid staff, and we can't demand the same commitment from them. I believe that, to be sustainable, the project can't rely on volunteers.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is not completely clear to me how the project will be executed. I understand there will be events, but it's not clear where, how they be conducted and what will their content be. 
The budget is not detailed, I would like to know how they came up with these percentages. I think it could be a bit more structured, with information of what would be included in the "Marketing Budget" and so on. 
There is little information about the team.
f6_assessments.q2: I believe the items to measure the progress are a good start, but I don't think it's enough to measure the success of the project. I would like to know the expected attendance for the event and how the feedback will be collected for example.

f6_assessments.q0: The Challenge wishes to encourage Local Community Hubs to drive adoption and awareness of Cardano. This proposer has a startup community hub which has gained momentum and given the market size of universities and major business this would increases the opportunity to expand knowledge and awareness about Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has demonstrated that he already understands how to gain participants in his current meetup group. Also he has developed a following on social media. Along with experience with interviewing people and creating multimedia content. He states he also has skills in marketing which is critical.  These combination of skills make me believe his is capable of success.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has identified his objectives and  risk clearly. His budget is broken down into reasonable percentages. His roadmap and KPIs from week 1 thru week 10 are planned and measurable. He has identified 7 unique auditable points that can be measured and followed.

f6_assessments.q0: How to tap into the 500 colleges and 9000 plus IT companies in the Northern Eastern US? That’s the problem that this proposal is trying to solve. I think that students and technical people are a great target for this challenge. These people can join the Cardano ecosystem and integrate the army of builders or just regular users. For those reasons, the proposal is in the scope of this challenge. Furthermore, a successful implementation of this proposal will add a lot of value in the ecosystem. I think that the proposer has done a good job by setting goals and metrics that align with the outlined challenge setting.
f6_assessments.q1: Although the impact of this challenge is pretty good, I think that the implementation needs to be improved. The proposer didn’t provide any information about the team needed to achieve the goals of this proposal. For his defense, the proposer has a good youtube channel with many quality videos that has boosted my confidence in his skills and experience. I’m a digital marketer, so I can recognize quality works whether it’s on youtube, websites or social media. I know that the proposal should be improved, but in this case, I’m betting on the man and will give this a good rating. In case this proposal doesn’t get funded, I suggest to the proposer to add information on the team needed to complete the work -  I also suggest adding a detailed roadmap with milestones - and lastly, I recommend writing a better budget breakdown. I give this a 4 for feasibility mostly because of the youtube channel which proves that man should be capable to complete the work
f6_assessments.q2: I gave a 4 rating on the feasibility of this proposal being really generous. However, the auditability of this proposal is lacking some crucial information. A roadmap is missing, the metrics/KPIs that define success are weak. I recommend to the proposer to add a good roadmap with reasonable milestones. I also suggest taking the time and thinking of good metrics which make the tracking of this progress easy. Other than that, I think that this proposal is strong on the impact of needs improvements on the auditability and feasibility area.

solution: The Hub will Market Cardano Blockchain to Universities and Tech Companies and facilitate in-person events, accelerating the Network Effect.
experience:
Mostafa Ismaeil
Mostafa The Cardano Guy (@MostafaCoin Twitter, 2k+ follows, daily writeups)LinkedIn 500+Founded the Cardano Phila Meetup Group (30+ members in 2022)Video Content Creator (Interviewing Crypto Founders, Teaching uDemy 7k, YT etc.)College Degree in Psychology
